articles.headline: What Texas Gains by Investigating Twitter’s Fake Accounts
articles.snippet: For Ken Paxton, the state attorney general, there are positives. Aligning with Elon Musk? Check. Politically helpful? Check.
articles.abstract: For Ken Paxton, the state attorney general, there are positives. Aligning with Elon Musk? Check. Politically helpful? Check.
articles.lead_paragraph: When Elon Musk said on Twitter last month that he planned to vote Republican and predicted that Democrats would mount a “dirty tricks campaign against me,” he received a warm response from Ken Paxton, the attorney general of Texas.
articles.byline: By David McCabe and J. David Goodman

articles.headline: A Vanishing Word in Abortion Debate: ‘Women’
articles.snippet: Progressive groups and medical organizations have adopted inclusive language, which has led to terms like “pregnant people” and “chestfeeding.”
articles.abstract: Progressive groups and medical organizations have adopted inclusive language, which has led to terms like “pregnant people” and “chestfeeding.”
articles.lead_paragraph: The American Civil Liberties Union, whose advocacy on reproductive rights is of more than a half-century vintage, recently tweeted its alarm about the precarious state of legal abortion:

articles.headline: Twitter Said to Agree to Give Elon Musk Access to Stream of Tweets
articles.snippet: The move may make it tougher for Mr. Musk, who has said he is not getting enough information from the company, to end the $44 billion acquisition.
articles.abstract: The move may make it tougher for Mr. Musk, who has said he is not getting enough information from the company, to end the $44 billion acquisition.
articles.lead_paragraph: Elon Musk has threatened to pull out of a $44 billion deal for Twitter, saying the company has refused to give him information about its fake accounts.
articles.byline: By Lauren Hirsch and Mike Isaac

articles.headline: Russia Is Racing to Cement Its Control in Southern Ukraine
articles.snippet: The Kremlin says it has rebuilt rail and road links to Crimea, while appointing proxy officials in an effort to create facts on the ground.
articles.abstract: The Kremlin says it has rebuilt rail and road links to Crimea, while appointing proxy officials in an effort to create facts on the ground.
articles.lead_paragraph: Even as Russia hammers eastern Ukraine with heavy artillery, it is cementing its grip on the south, claiming to have restored roads, rails and a critical freshwater canal that could help it claim permanent dominion over the region.
articles.byline: By Marc Santora, Thomas Gibbons-Neff, Anton Troianovski and Michael Levenson

articles.headline: As Survivors Demand Action, House Passes Gun Bill Doomed in the Senate
articles.snippet: On a day of wrenching testimony from victims of the school shooting in Uvalde, Democrats pushed through a gun control package facing solid G.O.P. opposition and no path in the Senate.
articles.abstract: On a day of wrenching testimony from victims of the school shooting in Uvalde, Democrats pushed through a gun control package facing solid G.O.P. opposition and no path in the Senate.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The House on Wednesday voted nearly along party lines to bar the sale of semiautomatic weapons to people under the age of 21 and ban the sale of large-capacity magazines, acting as traumatized parents of victims and survivors of mass shootings made wrenching appeals for Congress to act on gun violence.
articles.byline: By Annie Karni and Catie Edmondson

articles.headline: A Full Return to the Office? Does ‘Never’ Work for You?
articles.snippet: Employer plans have played out like a game of chicken. Now workers are rebelling outright, and executives are trying everything to make the office worth it.
articles.abstract: Employer plans have played out like a game of chicken. Now workers are rebelling outright, and executives are trying everything to make the office worth it.
articles.lead_paragraph: To hear more audio stories from publications like The New York Times, download Audm for iPhone or Android.

articles.headline: European Central Bank says it will raise interest rates for the first time in 11 years in July.
articles.snippet: After a decade of low inflation, the bank is facing the highest rate of price increases since the creation of the euro currency.
articles.abstract: After a decade of low inflation, the bank is facing the highest rate of price increases since the creation of the euro currency.
articles.lead_paragraph: The European Central Bank entered a new era on Thursday, as policymakers clearly stated their plan to raise interest rates next month for the first time in more than a decade to tackle inflation.

articles.headline: ‘Trump Was at the Center’: Jan. 6 Hearing Lays Out Case in Vivid Detail
articles.snippet: The House panel investigating the attack led its public sessions with video testimony from people close to the former president about his actions before and during the riot.
articles.abstract: The House panel investigating the attack led its public sessions with video testimony from people close to the former president about his actions before and during the riot.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The House Select Committee to Investigate the Jan. 6 Attack on the United States Capitol opened a landmark set of hearings on Thursday by showing video of aide after aide to former President Donald J. Trump testifying that his claims of a stolen election were false, as the panel laid out in meticulous detail the extent of the former president’s efforts to keep himself in office.

articles.headline: A Plea From German Brewers: Bring Back Your Empties
articles.snippet: A nation of beer lovers is facing a shortage of bottles, partly because of the war in Ukraine. Breweries are looking to drinkers for a rescue.
articles.abstract: A nation of beer lovers is facing a shortage of bottles, partly because of the war in Ukraine. Breweries are looking to drinkers for a rescue.
articles.lead_paragraph: Stefan Fritsche, who runs a centuries-old German brewery in Neuzelle, near the Polish border, has seen his natural gas bill jump a startling 400 percent over the past year. His electricity bill has increased 300 percent. And he’s paying more for barley than ever before.
